Australia: South Australia became the first Australian colony, and the second place in the world, to grant women the right to vote, as well the first Parliament in the world to allow women to stand for office.
Belgium:
Jules de Burlet replaces Auguste Beernaert as Prime Minister
International Exposition (world's fair) in Antwerp
Belgian general election, 1894
Brazil:
Rio de Janeiro Affair: a series of incidents during the Brazilian Naval Revolt.
Federalist Riograndense Revolution: Battle of Passo Fundo in the state of Rio Grande do Sul
Inauguration of Prudente de Morais as president.
China: First Sino-Japanese War: War was officially declared between Japan and the Qing dynasty.
Colombia: Miguel Antonio Caro is the 6th president of Colombia
France:
The Franco-Russian Alliance was confirmed.
Jean Casimir-Perier began his term as president of France.
The Dreyfus affair begins, creating a scandal which will mobilize intellectuals and divide the French population for a decade.
Indinesia: Lombok war The Dutch looted and destroyed the Cakranegara palace of Mataram. J. L. A. Brandes, a Dutch philologist discovered and secured Nagarakretagama manuscript in Lombok royal library.
Philippine: Sorsogon province was separated from Albay province.
Russia: Alexander III dies. His son Nicholas II succeeds him as tsar.
Singapore: Sir Charles Bullen Hugh Mitchell was appointed as the Governor of the Straits Settlements.
Slovenia:
First public power station in Škofja Loka is built.
The railway line on the route Ljubljana – Novo Mesto is built.
